Reviews.Title: “Great service with everything!”
Reviews.Author: Pichetbo
Reviews.Content: Checked in after 8pm and the staff found our name with no time. Nice room with full kitchen. Breakfast is great with waffle machine. So, my daughter had fun making one. She forgot her stuff animals. They found them in no time. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: basiap
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the accomodations and service at the Residence Inn San Diego Central. The last time we visited San Diego we stayed at the La Jolla Residence Inn, but they now charge for parking, so we ruled that out. The San Diego Central is in a great location, only minutes from anywhere we wanted to go. The rooms are comfortable and clean; the stoves might be a little dated, but we were on vacation - I wasn't doing any cooking. Breakfast is great with a good selection to meet anyone's needs. Several evenings a week they also have a "manager's reception" which is basically a light dinner buffet. We had dinner plans the nights we were there, but we happened to notice that they served meat lasagna & veggie lasagna one night and veggie and meat chili another night. They also serve salad, bread, veggies, beer and wine. I would recommend this property for business travelers as well as families on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here next time in San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: bruz97
Reviews.Content: Convenient location. Nice breakfast area and nice variety of food. Clean...both room and grounds!!!! Enjoyed our stay and will return next visit to area. Staff very friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Come and stay while....”
Reviews.Author: stylnz8
Reviews.Content: I have been here for a week and I have to say my room is conveniently located to where I need to be, it's clean, the beds are comfortable (a little more of a smooshy pillow would be nice but oh well). There's a couple nice restaurants around and they are dog friendly (there is a pet fee). There's breakfast in the morning and snacks at night for me. I love that they have a kitchen witha fridge so I can keep the raw food cold for my pups. I have stayed here acouple of times and the only thing I can find wrong with it is that it's always busy and the parking spaces are a little tight, other than that I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We'd go back”
Reviews.Author: cmd94583
Reviews.Content: When we booked this, we were looking for a reasonably priced hotel convenient to downtown but not in the heart of it. We were very pleased with the hotel and location, which was next to the freeway but unaffected by freeway noise. We made several trips to the downtown area and other surrounding neighborhoods and everything was within 10-15 minutes of the location. Our original room (studio queen) was on the ground level and the people above us must have had children because as soon as they arrived, the noise was annoying enough to require a room change (my husband is a light sleeper). The front desk staff was very accommodating and moved us to a larger 2-bedroom unit (upstairs) at no additional charge. What a fantastic setup if you need to sleep four or more in your room. We found both rooms to be well-equipped, clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffet in the morning was very good and definitely better than most and had a good variety of hot and cold foods. This was a very good value and we will definitely stay at this Residence Inn again when we return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms and exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: RustyDog2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here back in Sept. 2011 during the power outage. We stayed for 7 nights and couldn't have been happier. Despite being without power for about 12 hours, the experience was great. The staff went out of their way to make sure everyone was as comfortable as possible. People were given light sticks in an attempt to provide some light. They staff even opened the keg to allow people to make the best of the situation. We found the room, the location and the staff to be top notch. The rooms were a bit dated but they were exceptionally clean. The pool is on the small side but certainly clean and well kept. The breakfast was good and plentiful as were the evening receptions during the week. The light meals during the week included an entree, lasagna one night, soup and salad another night and hamburger and hot dogs another night as well as rolls, beer and wine. The staff does a great job handling the crowds and replenishing the food. If you are looking for a nice, friendly place to stay, this hotel is worth a stay. We will definitely stay here again. We were very happy with everything!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: kittiestone
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights here right before the New Year. We didn't want to stay in downtown because we didn't want to pay all the parking fees at the hotels. Residence Inn San Diego is so convenient to all the attractions. It's located right by the freeway but you don't hear any freeway noise. It's only 10 minutes on the freeway to downtown. The layout of the property is a long rectangle, with the front desk/breakfast area in the very front. Our room was in the middle, so it wasn't too far. I wouldn't want a room all the way in the back. The cabinets, drawers, and closets are a bit dated, but we didn't care.There's a full kitchen (also a bit dated) in the room, but we didn't really use it. It's really convenient if you stay here longer or if you have family. They give you free popcorn in your room so we enjoyed fresh popcorn in the evenings. The room rate also includes breakfast. The selection is decent and there are plenty of tables. The lobby area provides coffee and hot water for tea and hot chocolate. A very nice touch. Overall, we had a pleasant stay here. We would recommend it to our friends and family if they make a trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: LeoFam
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel with our Marriot points as we wanted a weekend trip to San Diego. The hotel is set up like an apartment complex just off the freeway. Our stay was very pleasant and rooms well maintained. They are a bit dated, but all the essentials were there and we had plenty of room for two adults and two children. They have free parking and free WiFi, and their breakfast is very well done. Rather than just pastries, you get eggs, sausage, pancakes, and other items. We were very impressed with the value this hotel provides. When my young daughter went to get a blueberry muffin, she began to cry when one of the Residence Inn employees working the breakfast area told her they were out. Within minutes, this lady came to our table with a special chocolate muffin for both my kids. I thought that was so sweet that she went back to the kitchen to find something to appease my daughter. We have stayed at several Residence Inn's over the years and I was very pleased with our stay at this one as well.

Reviews.Title: “Odd Layout, but a Nice Facility”
Reviews.Author: Landlubber_9354
Reviews.Content: We spent just one night here, using a free night that I had earned during the summer. The hotel is close and convenient to downtown and port. This particular Residence Inn is set up as a condensed apartment complex, with several two-story buildings with a limited number of rooms in each building, We passed a jacuzzi/spa between our room and the lobby/breakfast area. As with other Residence Inns there were barbecue areas. The parking was ample. Check-in was a bit goofy. We asked for an upstairs room, but ended up in a downstairs unit. We were tired at the time, so we did not go back. It turned out to be fine, as the people in the room upstairs were relatively quiet. The room itself was clean and a decent size, but the layout was a bit odd. When you enter the room, there is a convertible sofa directly in front of you. There is a small table/desk on the left, adjacent to the door. The kitchen and dining area is to the right. You walk throught the living area to get to the bedroom. A short passage way with a closet takes you from the bedroom to the bathroom. A nice touch is that the sink/vanity is separate from the bathtub/toilet. There were plenty of towels and toiletries. The bed was comfortable and the area was quiet. While the hotel is right off the freeway this property, and the buildings that make up the hotel, are set back from the street, away from freeway and road noise. The buffet breakfast was above average, including scrambled eggs, sausage, pancakes (as well as the waffle makers), toast/bagels/english muffins/muffins, juice, coffee/tea, milk, hot/cold cereal, yogurt and plenty of fresh fruit. There was ample seating in the breakfast area. Overall we were very happy with our stay at this Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Iris_BJ
Reviews.Content: I am a lazy person so I wouldn't write any review unless I am extremely impressed (either positively or negatively). In this case, Residence Inn exceeded my expectation in any way. 1. Excellent location: right by highway and just a short drive to Sea World, Old Town, Balboa Park, Zoo, etc. 2. Spacious room with full kitchen and dining area: this is very important for me as I need to cook for my baby. Also, it felt really good to enjoy some hot home-made noodle soup after eating "so so" fast food in Sea World (especially after a cold day as it seems there's no indoor seating in almost all restaurants in Sea World) 3. Free parking, free internet, free breakfast 4. Great services: whenever I requested a service (extra towels, crib set up, etc), staff would show up in 5 minutes and have things fixed right away. 5. With all above being said, the hotel price is of great value. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, especially families visiting San Diego. Oh, did I mention that it's fairly close to Chinatown and you can find several good Chinese restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “wish I could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: mka1021
Reviews.Content: The rooms were everything they were advertised to be...the two bedroom, two bath suite was perfect. I am the mother in law so I had my own loft with bath. The fireplace was beautiful on the cold rainy evenings and the breakfast was terrific! The location was good, parking free, staff wonderful, and all the extra's in the room were a surprise! I want to go back to San Diego just to stay at that hotel! From Mary in Hawaii

Reviews.Title: “Central Location & Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: lssrinivas
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this property as a part of our San Diego Zoo & Sea World visit and this hotel is very comfortable and conveniently situated close to the Freeway to the Zoo and Old San Diego! . GAs Station is close by and the room has many conveniences like Microwave and Refrigerator. Would surely recommend it for being a convenient property!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: mchar74
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my mom, and it was a wonderful experience. The hotel staff was very helpful in getting you checked in and out quickly and also provided directions. The room we had was the studio with the kitchen. We had the studio with the queen size bed, and if more space is needed, there is a sofa bed in the room and extra sheets and blanket. The kitchen had a full refrigerator, stove and oven, microwave and dish washer. Parking is complimentary, and we had no problem finding a stall near our unit, whether we came in at 5pm or 11pm. A big plus that we liked was the complimentary hot breakfast every morning. The menu changes from day to day, but it's no continental breakfast. It's a full hot meal including food items such as pancakes, link sausage, scrambled eggs, to name a few. If you are there on Monday-Wednesday, they serve a complimentary dinner to guests. We stayed on a Monday night, and was treated to chicken, corn and potato wedges. I wasn't expecting a full meal to be served. Vons and CVS are both a quick drive away and the freeway entrances and exits are very near and accessible. This was an excellent stay since we wanted to be outside of the downtown area, but still be centrally close to the main attractions, such as Sea World (15 minutes away), and San Diego Zoo Safari Park (35 minutes away). One thing that I would recommend is to have a car when staying at this hotel. The stores and restaurants are somewhat far to walk and a car may be ideal. But remember, parking is complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: shell1952
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located, close to the freeway and a great value, especially on weekends. The rooms are a good size, the bed was comfortable and the fully furnished kitchen is a plus. The hotel is well maintained and nicely furnished. The reception staff are friendly and helpful, and will help you find whatever you are looking for. The free breakfast has a lot of variety and is the average residence inn breakfast, but great if you are traveling with children. There are not many restaurants in the immediate vicinity. Be aware that this hotel is not far from the Miramar Naval Air Station and you will frequently hear the fighter jets taking off and flying in the area, especially in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Cute & Cozy.................GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: SweetBeene
Reviews.Content: We went to San Diego for a family wedding September 9-11, 2011. We booked our room 2 months in advance, we were hesitant about the hotel becuase our quoted rate was $98.00 plus tax per night with HOT continental breakfast included........ YIKES!!! why so cheap, but how bad could it be it's MARRIOT for crying out loud we bit the bullet and stepped out on faith...... GLAD we did, Great hotel perfect location away from the hustle and bustle and congestion of San Diego's tourist attractions.... Tina at the front desk was the first friendly face, she is a GREAT ball of sunshine. Check in was FASSSSSST she printed out direction and food delivary locations for us,While remaining polite and professional. Our room was 1313 lower level (see picture). room was extremely comfortable FULL kitchen, ice maker microwave and coffee maker.............. pot, pans plates you name it they had it. Breakfast was YUMMY!! No bacon or saussage the 1st morning we survived. Many other choices The Mister LOVED the apple juice. Saturday we met David = AWESOME, breakfast was GREAT and yes there was saussage..... Jacuzzi and swimmimg pool were both clean and quiet. We can NOT wait until our next trip to San Diego this will be our NEW home away from home....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way, awesome staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: rma125
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week and had a fabulous stay. The staff was first class and extremely helpful at all times. We loved the pool and jacuzzi, used the laundry and pleasant interactions with the maids. parking was easy and we were right off the 15 so travel anywhere was a breeze. The beds were very comfortable, the TV was huge and the bathroom was superb. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Super helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: drdanmay
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several Residence Inns in the past with our daughter's basketball travel. The staff here were very helpful and friendly every time we encountered them. We requested a room change to get better sunlight, and the staff was happy and almost eager to assist us. The breakfast was very good and the rooms were comfortable as they usually are at a Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: wemarionFishnGolf
Reviews.Content: The room was pretty good but the bed was pretty worn and not in the best shape. Really detracted from the nice size of the room and Residence Inn features. The breakfast was one of the better Residence Inn breakfasts I've had.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - will be back”
Reviews.Author: Reiselustig1984
Reviews.Content: I have nothing bad to say about the Residence Inn. They delivered from the start to the end. We were greeted warmly by Tina at the front desk and had a fast and easy check in (and later check out). Our room was more like a suite - unlike most of the budget hotels/motels we stayed at prior to Residence Inn (even the more expensive ones) it didn't smell like.. well.. cheap motel :) Our room was bright and roomy and beautiful and most important - CLEAN !!!!! The room was beautiful and decorated tastefully. We had a lot of room (travelling with a 9 month old crawler) and a crib was already set up for our convenience. She even got a bath toy as a welcome gift! The kitchen was awesome (nicer than our kitchen at home...) and clean. Everything seemed to be new and very clean. The kitchen was fully equipped and we had everything and more than we needed. The room had a great feel and we felt very comfortable and like my husband put it - like home. He usually complains about the places we stay at but this time he was really really impressed. The hotel is very close to the 163 freeway (but not noisy!) just with an easy access to the 805 and 163. There is a Mobil gas station next to it. We had dinner in Old Town and had left overs, so we didn't have to look for food in that area but I saw some sandwich places nearby in walking distance. The hot breakfast in the morning was a lot better than other places we stayed at, plus it was included in the price which was great. There's also a tennis court and pool and several spas. Everything was very clean and very well maintained. We were very impressed and will return the next time we're in San Diego for a long weekend. Loved it :)

Reviews.Title: “good deal”
Reviews.Author: lajune1958
Reviews.Content: rooms clean, full kitchen, housekeeping good, the best deal was the full breakfast bar daily and dinner monday-thursday

Reviews.Title: “You could not ask for more at this hotel! Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: CC9876
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom bi-level penthouse suite, queen bed with bathroom upstairs and king bedroom with its own bathroom downstairs, as well as full kitchen, and living area with sleeper sofa. The heated pool was great for the kids, and this hotel offers a FREE breakfast AND dinner/appies with FREE beer and wine! What more could you possibly need for your stay!? No complaints here! We stay in a lot of hotels and we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Extended Stay Hotel, Hands Down”
Reviews.Author: GregRidgecrest_CA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best that I have ever stayed at of any class in any country. The suites are huge, very comfy, and very well appointed. It has the feel of a condo, and the service is fantastice. The free breakfast and dinner is great, and so is the free beer. There is a pool and spa, small gym, and a laundry. Its in sort of an earthy neighborhood with massage parlors and strip joints, but also really good restaurants. I highly recommend this place to the business traveler, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: drbud1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 months because of soot damage in our home. We loved it. We stayed in one of the two story two bedroom suites. It had a full kitchen and small living room area. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. They really took care of us. On site laundry is clean and less expensive than a laundermat. Free breakfast is great and M-Th they have free snacks/dinner. We have two dogs and I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone travelling with a pet. Not just pet friendly, but pet welcoming. Plenty of grass area surrounding to walk the dogs. We were able to leave the dogs in the room, not crated, when we went to work or wherever. Great freeway access to anywhere you want to go in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated motel quality room”
Reviews.Author: lovingmykids
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after reading so many positive review for labor day vacation for 3 nights. In my opinion, the room is more like a motel quality room than a hotel, not worth the amount of money they charged us for (over $100 a night). The kitchen appliances are all outdated, the refrigeritor's door can barely stay shut, looks like more than 10 years old, so does the range, and old tube tv. The room does not smell good either because of bad ventilation, bacony was really small. We stayed for the weekends, so no light dinner, the breakfast was always crowded and ran out of food quickly, have to wait for a long time for them to refill.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location - Close to Downtown”
Reviews.Author: WldHrt60
Reviews.Content: Larger than normal rooms but not actual suite with separate living room and bedroom. Having a full kitchen is nice when staying for a while. Pool is small for number of rooms. Free breakfast and happy hour is a treat and saves money.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good”
Reviews.Author: Printman2000
Reviews.Content: I was on a family vacation to San Diego with my wife and two kids, 12 & 9. We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. This hotel looks more like an apartment complex than a hotel. We were in a two story duplex room which was on the second and third floor. All doors are outside and we had to go up stairs to our front door. Our room was in a center building so there was no parking nearby. I required walking into the interior walkways. No big deal, but something that does make getting luggage in an out a bit more difficult. Our room (apartment) had a living room with a TV and a couch with a fold out bed, kitchen area with frig, stove, oven and microwave, a master bedroom with a king size bed, TV, desk and a bathroom, and an upstairs loft bedroom with a queen size bed, TV and a bathroom. Obviously plenty of room for the four of us. Both kids had their own room and TV. Everything looked real clean. The beds were a little hard, but not bad. No wireless internet in the rooms, only a wired connection. A little limiting, but okay. Each day, if would bring up a screen where you had to sign up. You can pay for multiple day access or just select the one day free option. The only bad thing is you have to do that every day if you want the free access. The laundry room is up in the main office building. Machines worked well. Seems cost was $1.25 per cycle. They have a miniature tennis court and a basketball goal. The pool seemed well used, but we did not have a chance to use it. Breakfast was okay. Not too much variety, but the quality was pretty good. Three or four hot items along with normal bagels, toast and two waffle makers. They have orange and apple juice as well as a soft drink dispenser. Breakfast can get pretty crowded. We had to sit outside at tables a couple of days. Seems the later you go, the more crowded. The location is not bad at all. It is only about 15 minutes from downtown and most major attractions. It is right next to a freeway so it has easy access. The price we paid was just a bit higher than I would have liked. I would have given this hotel a perfect score if it was just a little cheaper. A very good stay at a very good hotel that we would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Indian food available when asked”
Reviews.Author: sshenoy
Reviews.Content: This place is very near to the business offices and they provide free pick up and drop till 5 km , hospital and malls fall in 5 km radius. The staff is extremely friendly and they assist for every small thing needed. When asked to prepare rice they did it, i woulld love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay - great value.”
Reviews.Author: miafamilia
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The value was great. We ate breakfast there every morning and the food was good. The evening reception was nice too. There was free beer and wine as well as a light meal and fresh popped popcorn. Mattress was comfortable. Linens were clean. Fresh towels every day. Washers/Dryers onsite that was clean. They were very accommodating. The location was fantastic but if you are looking for picturesque, this is not the place. You are off the highway next to another hotel. But we didn't care because we were only at the hotel after we did our park stuff at the end of the day. We were 6 minutes to La Jolla beaches, 15 minutes to the airport, 25 minutes to Lego Land and close to the Zoo, Wild Animal Park and Seaworld. Because we saved on the lodging, we did extra things with the kids. The parks and food are expensive. If it happens to rain when you go like it did when we went, skip the Alien exhibit at the Museum of Flight and Aviation. That was $70 for four with the AAA discount. Total waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient layout”
Reviews.Author: Hampshire123
Reviews.Content: It took 8 hours to get to San Diego from Monterey and the Residence Inn seemed to be a bit out of the way - but the layout of the split level rooms is just so convenient. Two bedrooms and two bathrooms, too many televisions, a proper kitchen area with dishwasher and good sized fridge, more than enough storage... And free wired internet - they provide the wires and it just worked. The laundry facilities were useful for us and other families were using the hot tub and swimming pool. Although it is not in the main area, it is quiet and easy to get to restaurants, shops and onto the main routes to get around San Diego. The front desk gave us a list of local restaurants and we tried a few - mostly thanks to Fillipi's, on Clairmont Mesa, who did a great pizza and salad to go on a day when we were too exhausted to dine out. We didn't do breakfast - we found it's never quite what you want and very busy. The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly, as were the room attendants but there did seem to be a bit of friction among breakfast staff. Didn't seem to affect those who like the waffles though!

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed ourselves”
Reviews.Author: hassanScott
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed ourselves here. The area was pleasant & we would stay there again if we were in the area. We preferred it over being in town, but if you don't have a car you would prefer being in town. Breakfasts didn't change and the kids got bored of it after a while. Plenty of room though, and two waffle makers.

Reviews.Title: “3 1/2 Stars -- Good For Families”
Reviews.Author: erune
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family...4 of us including children ages 2 and 4. Love the room itself. Large, with a full kitchen, living room with fireplace, two bedrooms, two bathrooms, desk to do work, etc. The kids loved going upstairs to check it out and having all that room to stay. The rate is very reasonable and it even includes a full breakfast with eggs, potatoes, cereal, yogurt, donuts, waffles...you name it. BUT, I have to tell you this area is not quite as nice and touristy as the gaslamp district. It's not very close to the airport either. There's a pretty good shopping center about 5 miles away and we went there for dinner. Just so you know, the rooms are far apart and if you get a room on the 2nd floor in the back of property, it's a haul to get all your luggage from your car to the room and back. No elevators so beware. This property is kind of like a condiminium complex. Buildings have two floors, 8 rooms on the top and 4 on the bottom. Entrances are at each corner of the building and spread out. And...if you're in a rush in the morning and think that you'll rush in when the breakfast starts and then get out in 10 minutes, don't even think about it. The staff starts setting up at their own leisure. You can get there at 7 am (when they claim it starts) and they won't have everything set up. No eggs, no potatoes, no waffle batter. But at 7:10 you'll be good to go. Maybe it's me, but if it says it starts at 7am, that's the latest everything should be ready. Can't always expect good customer service, right?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice. Excellent value. Convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: LavaJava96
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at the Residence Inn Central for 7 nights, and it was very nice, and we have no complaints at all. We booked a bi-level suite, with the fireplace. The beds were King and Queen. My children loved having their own upstairs bedroom with the queen bed, as well as their own bathroom. There was tons of storage everywhere, with lots of closets. We cooked a little one night. We even lit the fireplace one night and I baked cookies. The pool was heated, a little small, but was fine. We also liked the two jacuzzis. The breakfast was pretty good, and we liked the make your own waffle machine. We came back a few nights for the complimentary appetizers/manager dinner (Mon-Thurs only) and that was really nice. They have theme nights where one night, it could be deli, and the next can be BBQ, or italian. They also had free wine and beer, too. Awesome. The rooms were very clean, the beds were comfortable. We had 3 tvs which were awesome. The location was good - right off of the highway, and there were lots of restaurants nearby (driving distance). On Conway Street, we discovered some great Asian restaurants (Vietnamese, Korean) that our kids loved! We were about 10-15 minutes from SD ZOO, and 25 minutes from Legoland. The hotel provides preprinted cards with driving directions. So convenient! The lobby has free newspapers, and a computer for guests to use to send an email, etc... And parking was free and plentiful. We felt very safe. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: luciamia
Reviews.Content: Our family (myself, husband, and 5 kids ages 6-17) spent 5 nights in one of the bi-level suites and loved every minute of it! We have traveled quite a bit and stayed in many different types of "suites" over the years - but this hotel was one of the most comfortable. With two bathrooms, 3 beds (including the sofa sleeper) and a fully stocked kitchen we all "fit" and had plenty of room to spread out. Parking is free and there was plenty of room for our oversized Yukon! The management was very friendly and helpful, providing printed instructions for nearby attractions. The rooms were clean, the beds comfortable with nice linens. Housekeeping was quick to bring us extra towels and pillows when we requested them. The free breakfast buffet (daily) and 'social hour' (Mon-Thurs I believe) were great. My kids enjoyed making their own wafles and breakfast burritos, and I enjoyed the fresh fruit and yogurt every morning. Far superior to the 'continental breakfast' of stale donuts and muffins advertised by many hotels! While some have mentioned that the social hour buffet selections aren't the most healthy - they are *free* after all, and, during our stay at least, there was always salad and raw vegies available. These buffet selections, supplemented by fruit, vegies, ect.. purchased at the local grocery provided several dinners for our family after a busy day at the zoo or seaworld. (We always took the food back to our room on the provided trays). There is also free beer, wine, and soft drinks available, as well as coffee, hot chocolate, and a selection of teas. My kids played in the warm pool and hot tub (one of 3 hot tubs I believe) every evening and had a great time, and my older boys kept up on their facebook pages on the free computer in the hotel lobby. However late in the morning we left, or early in the day we returned, our room was always cleaned and tidy. Dishes done, linens changed when we requested it, they even arrranged some fruit we'd left in bags on the counter into a bowl! I suppose to make the hotel *perfect* you could enlarge the pool and move the entire establishment right next to the ocean. But the location is great for doing those "San Diego family attractions", and the hotel has an overall friendly, comfortable feeling. We look forward to staying at the Residence Inn again on our next San Diego trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a deal!”
Reviews.Author: Bound4NZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn with our two small children for 10 days. Excellent service, value, rooms and location. We had the studio room, but was able to find enough privacy for our baby to nap near the bathroom area. The best part of this hotel is the value. During the week (Monday through Thursday) breakfast AND dinner are included in your hotel stay. On the weekends, when we cooked, the kitchens inside the rooms are fully stocked with just about every pot, pan, and cooking utensil you could ever need. Excellent service and friendly staff! The housekeepers even do your dishes!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of "sticky finger" housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: lovinthemouse16
Reviews.Content: We picked the Residence Inn based on TA's reviews. Stayed for 6 nights and everything was great for the first 5 days. Friendly, attentive staff. Food was good. Very spacious and comfortable rooms. Close to all attractions. But on the 5th cleaning day for housekeeping, my daughter's $150 Chi hair straightner was stolen. And yes, I know they are not responsible for valuables, but let's face it, you can only hide so much of your valuables. The manager did make an adjustment on the room for us, but suggested that when he spoke with his employee, she stated she doesn't use a straightner and would not have a need for one. He suggested someone came in while she was cleaning and stole it! I just had to laugh. So just beware of your valuables if you choose to stay here. Otherwise great place, but I would never go back nor suggest anyone else stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: otsumami
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn for one night in May 2009 during our family vacation. We had plans to visit La Jolla, Coronado Island, and Wild Animal Park; and needed a hotel that was conveniently near all these attractions without all the traffic congestion and parking fees. (10 minutes to downtown San Diego and La Jolla, 30 minutes to Wild Animal Park.) My stay at this hotel easily ranks as one of the best I have ever had at a hotel in the U.S. The hotel is relatively new and it was so clean and well-kept that I would have believed the manager if he had told me that I was the first person to ever stay in my room. We had requested both a penthouse suite and a studio suite to accommodate our party, and the manager placed us in the same building right above each other. (The hotel consists of multiple two-story buildings in two long rows.) Both suites were immaculate and spacious; the beds, workstation, and couches were very comfortable. Parking was easy and the spots wide enough to easily accommodate larger vehicles such as SUVs, minivans, etc. The free breakfast buffet included both hot items (scrambled eggs, potatoes, make-your-own waffle, etc.) and cold items (cereal, bagels, fruit, etc.). There were trays for transporting your breakfast back to your suite if you would rather eat in the comfort of your room instead of the common area. I also saw a swimming pool, a two whirlpools, a bbq grill, and tennis courts, but did not use any of these facilities. This really was a great hotel. I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Worth The Drive!!”
Reviews.Author: PattyRRR
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in a range of different ratings (from 2 star to 5 star hotels) and I must say that I have never been so impressed with a hotel. This hotel is perfect for families or if you're traveling with friends, we got the bi-level penthouse and it was wonderful, how often do you find a hotel room with 2 full bathrooms at a reasonable rate? Even 2 bedroom suites at posh hotels usually only have 1 full bathroom. The hotel in not close to any attractions; and therefore my title "worth the drive." It is near a freeway and you probably have to drive 15 minutes to get to any of the San Diego attractions but it is so worth it... I mean, you get a mediocre hotel room on "hotel circle" and pay almost the same rate with none of the amenities. You will not be disappointed. I could go on and on about this hotel. The rooms are large, clean, the staff is attentive, the amenities are exceptional- breakfast is awesome, I mean, you can make your own waffles!! My only suggestion is to request a room near the dining room, if you have children and are planning on taking advantage of that service. Other than that everything was wonderful. We arrived late but our room was pre-assigned, I booked the "romance" package and there was a personalized card and a bottle of wine waiting in the room. The room has cooking utensils, everything that you might need, a full size refrigerator and the beds are so comfortable! Free parking, in California?? Yes! They even put your bill by the door on your check -out day. Someone wrote a review stating that this hotel was noisy and it was located by train tracks.. not true. I paid close attention to this because I have small children and there were no train tracks or planes in the area. It is by an industrial, office, car dealership area but there are plenty of fast food places nearby and grocery stores. Like I said worth the drive! Oh yeah, and they should really get faster wi-fi internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Great for traveling with little kids”
Reviews.Author: PickyMomVermont
Reviews.Content: My family rented a "penthouse" suite for $170 per night. Our suite had a full kitchen/living room area, and large master bedroom with king sized bed, full bath, and doors that separated it from the living room area. It also had an open second floor loft with a very comfortable queen sized bed, TV, and second full bath. We put our son in the master bedroom and then we could come and go out of the suite, stay up later than him, etc. without waking him up. The room rate came with a self-serve breakfast and a cocktail hour reception that many guests used as their dinner (simple food like hot dogs, chili, etc., salad, and free beer and wine). The room and the whole property were clean, the outdoor pool and hot tub were nice and warm, and the staff was pleasant and attentive. It was a great experience, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Experience...Room 1121”
Reviews.Author: goriajk
Reviews.Content: My Dad and I decided to come down to see the Bolts in the NFL Playoffs. We decided on this property, being close to Mission Valley and Downtown SD. I'm Marriott Silver and was welcomed nicely by the front staff. The room (1121) smelled a bit moldy at first, but as we got situated and the heater kicked in we were good. A nice small suite for 2 people - IMO. Coming back for the pool and Spa was very nice after the great Charger victory over the Colts. I needed it!!! We requested late check out (per my MR Silver) and they were quite accomodating. We drove back to L.A. knowing we were pleased and we would most certainly return to this Residence Inn. Good Job. Go Chargers!!! Joe G.

Reviews.Title: “Very Well Managed and Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: awfulcat
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Residence Inn for a week in mid-December with my wife and 1-year-old. I have stayed in "nicer" Residence Inns before, but this is probably the best run, best managed and had the nicest and most helpful staff. The rooms are kept very clean, although some fixtures could use an update. The beds and bed linens were very nice and comfortable and everything worked properly. Compared to other Residence Inns in the area, this is a great value. The surrounding area isn't the garden spot of SD, but it's right in the middle of everything SD has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: LALady020
Reviews.Content: We took the kids down to San Diego for a short end-of-summer trip. We stayed three nights at the Residence Inn - Central in a King Suite. This worked out well for us; the husband and I took the king bedroom downstairs, we put the 13 yr old in the loft upstairs (queen bed) and the 11 yr old in the pull out in the living room. It was nice that everyone had their own bed and there was enough room so that we weren't tripping over each other. There were TVs in both bedrooms and the living room. The two full baths were great and there was a full kitchen. We really didn't use it, but it was nice to have a full sized 'fridge for sodas, juice and such. Check in was fast and easy. The front desk staff seemed very knowledgeable about the area. They offer a buffet breakfast in the mornings, but we never took advantage of it. Housekeeping was very good - even running and emptying the dishwasher. The parking was free (almost unheard of in a San Diego hotel!) and there was no charge for the internet. The internet connection was wired, but we brought a wireless router along and the husband and I were able to run our laptops at the same time. The location isn't bad. The hotel is in an industrial area, but there are several family restaurants nearby (Denny's, IHOP, Islands) plus numerous fast food options. The local pizza place delivers to the hotel. We were about 6-7 miles away from the Zoo and SeaWorld, but we had a car so it wasn't a problem. I doubt it took more than 15 minutes to get anywhere. Overall, a great stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: BearAndPenguin
Reviews.Content: This is one of the older Residence Inns, however, it is well maintained and the staff is friendly and helpful. The suite was spacious and had everything we needed. The free breakfast was very good. I would recommend this hotel for longer stays because of its pod-like layout. There are maybe 15 different buildings each housing maybe 4 units. One thing to look out for: if you will have trouble carrying your suitcase, make sure to request a bottom-floor unit because I didn't see an elevator (although I could have missed it). Although this layout isn't ideal for a one-night stay; it would be convenient for a longer stay as you can go straight from your car into your suite, just like you would in an apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: MaxBarl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Residence INN San Diego Central during the last days of April for just two nights. We booked a two rooms two baths unit. It was reasonable. The hotel was not bad. Service was nice and friendly. Breakfast was fair. However, there was the same stuff all the days we stayed there. A major issue regards the cleanliness of the room, which is rather poor. The bathroom was almost unacceptable, with menstruation blood around the edge of the WC when we arrived. We also found some p… in the WC the day we arrived. We have never complained about this. We are not so good at speaking English, so we preferred to avoid complaining. However, the location is rather good and, to me, safe. Not so far from the city center by car and enough close to major supermarket and mall. Everything you need was at reasonable walking distance or 2-3 min driving.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to lay your head and have breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: wrldtrvlr8374
Reviews.Content: Trying to stay within the Marriott family and not wanting to pay for parking, we found the Residence Inn. I’ve never stayed at any of their other Residence Inns, so I was pleasantly surprised with what we got. After an easy check-in, we got back into our car to drive to our unit. It was easily a studio apartment with a king bed, pull out sofa bed, full kitchen (with a large fridge, stove, and microwave), desk, and a bathroom. I didn’t expect the whole kitchen part, so that was a nice plus. They also had free internet access in the rooms. (At the front desk, they make you sign a waiver saying you won’t throw any ‘parties’ in the rooms. Just an FYI in case that’s what you’re thinking!) They have free hot breakfasts from 7 am to 10 am on the weekends. I skipped Saturday morning, but the BF came back with bagels. On Sunday, they had other hot breakfast items available including tacos, waffles, yogurt, English muffins, bagels, granola, fresh fruit, etc. It's a pretty decent spread for breakfast. They also have other events going on throughout the week like happy hour that we didn’t get to check out. We didn’t utilize the pool or the gym that’s open 24 hours. The microwave popcorn and hot chocolate found in your room is a nice perk too. They even offer to do your grocery shopping for you for free! (You just pay for the groceries.) My only real complaint was that we called the front desk to inquire about daily cleaning. Since it was after 12, we wanted to make sure they could still clean our room. They said that housekeeping would be coming by shortly. When we returned after 3, our room still had not been made up. We called the front desk again and they sent someone over right away. We had to sit around for half an hour while things were getting tidied and that affected our schedule a bit. It’s located right off the freeway and very close to a choice of restaurants. $127/night plus tax.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel experience, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Philly_res
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Residence Inn for 4 nights in March 2008. It was a great experience. It was so good, that we will continue to use Residence Inns, even though our experience at the Garden Gate/Anaheim Residence Inn later that week was awful. The San Diego Central hotel was clean, the staff was extremely welcoming and pleasant, the environment was friendly and inviting. This despite the fact that the hotel was fully booked that week, including an entire soccer team of 10-year old boys. We were in building 12, overlooking the Shriner parking lot. It was very quiet, we never heard a noise from either the outside or from the adjoining rooms or buildings. We did have a problem with our refrigerator. It was very noisy. We had to turn it off at night because it would have kept us awake. However, we made one complaint to the front desk and they immediately sent a maintenance person to fix the fridge. When we returned to our room that night, there was a message asking us if the problem was fixed and offering to switch our room if we were not satisfied. Since we were not planning on storing any food, turning the thing off worked just as well for us. Speaking of food, the breakfast was very good. There was plenty of it (even with the millions of kids at the hotel) and of decent quality. There was adequate seating, as they had a second room they opened during peak times, and the patio was also available. During the evenings, there was beer and wine, and good amounts of hearty snacks. A popcorn machine and coffee carafes were available throughout the day. The room (we had the penthouse) worked very well for our family of 4. The 2 kids got the master suite, and then my husband and I had the run of the rest of the place once they went to bed. It was set up like a townhouse, with an open loft area with a queen size bed and full bath. I appreciated that even the living room had blackout curtains so we could sleep later even in the open loft area. The front desk was great. They had pre-printed cards with directions to every attraction we asked for, and restaurant recommendations in different areas. The pool was heated (almost to bath temps!), the laundry area was clean and convenient. 4 washers and 6 dryers. I suggest the front loading washer; you get a longer and better wash than the top-loaders. The location of the hotel was convenient to highways, although it was not particularly scenic. It was about 10 - 15 mins. depending upon traffic to Balboa Park and downtown San Diego. I highly recommend this hotel to all travelers (although we were a family on spring break, we also saw business travelers). It was a great value and a pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Residence Inn!!”
Reviews.Author: jul77
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at this Residence Inn, San Diego Central. We were able to check in early which was so nice after a long drive. We were met with smiling faces at the front desk. We loved our penthouse suite!! The set up is perfect for our family of five. The two girls slept upstairs, our son on the foldout sofabed and my husband and I in the downstairs king bedroom. During the day, it was great to take a nap and have the kids upstairs watching tv. The furnishings were nice with granite marble countertops. Housekeeping supplied us with many towels and kept the room very clean. We really appreciated how warm the pool was. Alot of hotel pools are heated but not this warm. It was like warm bath water. On Thursday night, they had a complimentary BBQ which consisted of hamburgers, pasta, fresh fruit,chips, soda, brownies, etc. It was wonderful!! The grounds were very pretty and nicely kept. It was a short 10-15 minute drive to Sea World and was not so crowded as other closer hotels. We would definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Penthouse Suite”
Reviews.Author: MichiganTravelingMom
Reviews.Content: My family spent a week at the Residence Inn in a Penthouse Suite. We absolutely loved it. We put our children (8, 5, 2) in the King Bedroom which had its own bathroom. We were able to close their door and have the rest of the place to ourselves at night. Our room was an upstairs loft (queen) with another bathroom. We ended up making many of our meals in the kitchen and the maid service always loaded and unloaded our dishwasher for us. We ate a hot breakfast every morning in the lobby and felt they had a nice selection (waffles, bagels, eggs, muffins, etc) We also enjoyed the food and drinks in the lobby on the week nights. Despite the fact that it was only in the 60's out, the pool was so warm that we went in it every day. We had it to ourselves which the kids loved. When our kids saw the room, they said, "We rented a house??" to tell you how big it was. I can't think of any complaints. We actually liked the location. It was very easy to get on the freeway from there and only about 15 minutes to the zoo or the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: DaphneMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The worst thing about this hotel would have to be the location. You are not exactly close to any of the attractions but situtated in what seemed like an industrial zone. The hotel is also closely situated to some kind of airport or base and you can hear jets/planes overhead most of the time. I'm not usually bothered by noise but this was really loud. We were told over the phone prior to booking that the hotel was very close to tourist attractions such as seaworld and the san diego zoo and that a cab would cost about $10-15. We later discovered the cab would cost closer to $50 each way. You can catch public transport but to get to the zoo for example you might need to take 3 buses and it will probably take you well over an hour. On the upside the staff were very very helpful. Probably among the most helpful and pleasant staff we have ever come across. The rooms are quite nice, clean and spacious though it might be time to update the bathrooms and the bathroom amenities. Food is not great but its free- well it was when we were there. The hotel offers free drinks and internet access which was nice. Probably wouldnt stay there again because of the location but if you have a car and you're not bothered by noise then the place is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Third time the charm”
Reviews.Author: SofiaReiziger
Reviews.Content: Checked in after a long flight, I decided to take a bath and had no hot water. Called the front desk and was told to keep the water running for a while until it's hot. When I finally convinced the reception clerk that there was no hot water in the studio, she checked and called me back later saying that maintenance shut down the water heater for the whole building but did not tell her. We had to repack and move to another studio in another building. Before unpacked, I decided to check the water. No hot water again! One more move and we finally got a room with hot water! The hotel is more like an apartment complex. It would be a long walk to breakfast if your room is located far from the front office. Breakfast and cocktail hour are good but not enough of tables and chairs. Internet connection is hard wired, not wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location. Doesn't feel safe.”
Reviews.Author: tripfafa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a industrial location. The neighborhood makes you feel unsafe. Especially there is a temple of some sort next door with a large, isolated parking lot. There is no fence or wall to seperate the parking lot from the hotel. During the night the empty parking lot gives me an uneasy feeling. The hotel itself needs some rennovation. It's OK inside rooms. However the lobby where breakfast is served is depressing. There is always a stale smell in rooms. We asked for a non-smoking room. But their idea of "non-smoking" is to have some air filter machine running overnight before the next guest check-in. The staff has been friendly though. But I'd not want to stay in this hotel next time I come to San Diego, primarily because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Be Better!”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous00001
Reviews.Content: We travel as a family of four with two little ones and we're always looking for a 1 or 2 BR suite. This hotel was everything we could have imagined. Simply perfect....and it was a very good AAA rate. Location couldn't have been better, just off CA163 and I-15. Made the short drive to Qualcomm Stadium easy and Sea World was just 11 minutes away. Very quiet location separated from Kearny Rd by a gas station and parking lot. Had its own free parking and also shared parking with a neighboring hotel and Shriner's temple. Had a 2-BR "penthouse" with a King downstairs and a Queen in a loft upstairs. Both BRs had full baths. TV and phone in each. Rooms were spotless and updated. Hi-speed internet connections in King BR (with desk). "Kitchenette" was effectively a full kitchen with diswasher, oven, stove, refrig, microwave. Eating area was a marble countertop with seating for 2-4. Living room had TV, phone, small desk, sofa & two chairs. The suite was new, super clean, and well-maintained. Like a new furnished apartment. There was a tennis court/basketball court near the lobby and a fitness center. Didn't check out the fitness center, but there was also a heated pool and a hot tub on premises that were in good shape. Free breakfast in the morning was well-stocked with a wide range of food and drinks. Nice lobby area, but bot enough seating for breakfast. There is additional seating near the pool deck. Free USA Today and SD paper in the lobby. Staff was very helpful and courteous. We checked in early and it was no problem. There was some work that needed to be completed on one of the three TVs in the room, and it was done within 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Residence Inn - Great for young families”
Reviews.Author: 55Cabbage
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a youg family. Five of us (me, my wife and 3 chidlren, 8, 5, 2) stayed over Thanksgiving. Polite, friendly staff checked us in to a Penthouse room. The room met our needs well but the loft room is really unsuitable for small children as there is a balcony which can easily be climbed over from the bed. It's about a 15 foot drop. So, my wife and I had that bed and my 3 kids share the King size downstairs. The pool was great but not heated...so my boys were a little shocked on entry (it was November!); but there was a hot tub right beside the pool. There's also a short tennis court which provided another diversion and a little exercise. Breakfast is great and because its included in the room rate it can save a large family a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: TreschichommeKC
Reviews.Content: I have to give this otherwise very nice hotel a mediocre rating for two reasons, one of which may not be the hotel's fault, but happened nonetheless. The good: The place is clean, rooms very nice and spacious, well-equiped and the maids very good. The staff I had contact with were very nice. There is quick access to 163 to Mission Valley, downtown and the beaches, the latter being accessible also by traveling on boulevards east and thus avoiding the highways. The bad: I asked for a quiet room and was put in an upstairs room at the very end of the linear set of buildings. The staff person said there had never been a complaint about noise. However, at 4:30 to 5:00 a.m. the very first morning I was awakened by REFUSE ofr RECYCLING CENTER dump trucks which were no more than thirty yards away from the back of the hotel! This continued every day. But for sleeping aids and earplugs it would have driven me crazy. Perhaps sound sleepers would not be bothered, but I was. Second, the last night a group of ne'erdowells decided to party in the room virtually adjacent to mine upstairs and have people in an out, apparently planning to do it all night. I felt ill at ease for my safety as these folks were talking trash and about their drug use, and hanging out right in front of my door. At one point I barricaded the door with the couch for security. I called the desk at 11:30 and they assured me that they were taking care of it. I called again later and was assured that police were coming to evict them, but of course it wasn't a priority call. Therefore I asked for another room at 12:30 a.m. since it was obvious I would never get any sleep. They were happy to comply and upgraded me. However, staff admitted that they realized these guys had a party planned when they checked in and had warned them against it, all to no avail. Hopefully this was a rare occasion, but not one I want to experience again. I was concerned that these guys would retaliate when they figured out who had complained, or damage my car, but none of that happened. I was smart enough not to confront them myself. So, this is a pretty nice place, just be prepared to ask for a room not close to the dumping center, or be a sound sleeper. As for the other matter, it was probably just bad luck.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Residence Inn San Diego Central”
Reviews.Author: lisadex
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was a good size and comfortable. There was a nice size kitchen with a microwave, frig, stove, refrigerator and a granite counter where two can eat. Our room had a sofa/bed and a queen size bed that was very comfortable. The pool is heated and is quite warm. The breakfast(it's included) had a lot of variety and was good. Overall we were very happy with our stay and plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Place”
Reviews.Author: rlbintegrity
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely fantastic! We were traveling with our married daughter and son-in-law who stayed in the loft of our 2-bedroom suite. Everything about this place was positive. First with the room. The beds and linens were top quality. The entire room was very clean. The living area was comfortable. We did not use the kitchen very much, but it was well-equipped if one chose to fix something in. The lobby area was very pleasant and the morning breakfast was top-notch. The evening supper was just alright, but nonetheless appreciated. Complimentary wine/beer was great. Everyone at the front desk was pleasant and attentive and went out of their way to help. The only negative aspect I can think of is that the hotel is located adjacent to a dump truck terminal. In the morning, the sound of the trucks might wake up a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Famil-Friendly”
Reviews.Author: vernon6264
Reviews.Content: My husband, mom and two kids, ages 10 and 12, stayed here for a week. We had a two-bedroom suite, #122, right next to the pool which was very convenient. Our room was ready upon arrival. It's challenging lugging a 40-pound suitcase up the stairs, so be prepared if that's not something you want to do. You'll have to do it again to get to the second floor. The unit was nice - the downstairs bathroom fan didn't work so it was a little steamy after a shower. The beds were comfortable and the unit was furnished to make your stay convenient. One day our kids left the do not disturb magnet on the door so housekeeping didn't make up the room, but they did leave a bag of clean towels outside the door which was a nice gesture. The pool was cleaned daily and the water was incredibly warm, great for those of us who aren't into a freezing pool in the summer - it felt fabulous. An adequate number of lounge chairs and tables with umbrellas made a place for everyone. A hot tub is also available. The breakfast was not bad - we typically stay at Embassy Suites so we're spoiled by their made-to-order items and huge selection. All in all, however, the Residence Inn was pretty good. It can get busy in the morning but the staff does their best to keep up. Free papers and the Today Show in the lobby give the place a homey touch. The convenience store off the lobby was great when the kids wanted a small Ben and Jerry's ice cream snack. The afternoon snacks are fine - popcorn is good but don't expect mixed drinks, just beer, wine and sodas. As most reviewers write, this location is very convenient to a number of places and is easy to find right off of 163. If you have small kids, you might want to request a room closer to the lobby so you don't have to walk as far - this venue does seems to be long and narrow.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: blackvelvetntucson
Reviews.Content: my husband, two children (11 & 13) stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and had a great time. check in time is at 4pm, and they do not budge on this. we arrived in san diego at 9am, and checked on the hotel for early check in. we were told it would be "a couple of hours." we went to the san diego zoo, ate lunch and went back to the hotel at 2pm. the room was still "unavailable". we went to westfield mall, walked around until we were completely exhausted and returned to the hotel at 3:45. the hotel clerk said the room would not be "available" until 4pm. we camped in the lobby for 15 minutes and finally got our keys. other than not checking in early, the stay was fantastic. we stayed in the penthouse suite, which was immaculate; with one loft bedroom upstairs with full bath, full kitchen, separate dining room with sofa bed, and 1 bedroom with full bath separated by french doors. each bedroom and the living room had separate tvs. we went to a local market and bought fresh fruit, salad, yogurt, and bottled water for the fridge. beleive it or not, this saved a lot of money, and we avoided high calorie, non nutritious snacks. the continental breakfast was very satisfying; including scrambled eggs and meat. each morning had a different theme: burritos, tacos, croissants, biscuits and gravy. it was crowded on weekend mornings, more relaxing on the weekday. mon-thurs there was an evening hospitality time with wine and light fare. pool and jacuzzi looked inviting, although we did'nt take a dip. basketball/tennis/volleyball court was great for the kids and my husband. workout room had weight machine, treadmill (which was out of order), stepper, bike, and a scale. laundry room came in handy. we packed light, and spent 1hr of our trip to wash. if you forget detergent, they have a 24hr sundry where u can charge items to the room. single use box of tide was $1. we had a great time here as it was spacious, comfortable, and quit. located next door to a gas station, seconds to the freeway, and minutes from restaurants, this was an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: drizzly7609
Reviews.Content: Our family of four was at Residence Inn San Diego Kearney Mesa and loved it. The room was clean and comfy. The bed was great and the pull-out couch slept two adult-sized people comfortably. The kids loved the pool, which was clean, and the spa. The people there were very helpful to a person. Not one encounter that was less than professional and helpful. Breakfasts were filling but not gourmet (hey. it's a Residence Inn!) and there was free wired Internet access from the suites. The only thing they could do would be to provide free wireless from the breakfast area. For some reason, the wireless is ridiculously expensive, like $4.95/15 minutes. The hotel is centrally located, adjacent to the freeway, easy on and easy off. We recommend it highly!

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn San Diego Central
HotelInfo.Address: 5400 Kearny Mesa Road, San Diego, CA 92111
